title: Work in progress
body:
This is how far I’ve got with my macro bench so far. It’s nearly all scavenged off ebay over three or four months.

1. Sainsbury’s Butcher’s Block

2. Zeiss microscope focus block, turret sawn off - subject stage base and z axis

3. Mild steel plate

4. Dial test indicator holder with magnetic base - flash mount

5. Pentax AF200T manual flash

6. Aluminium adapter

7. Proxxon milling table - very coarse x axis, y axis

8. Nikon microscope focus block - coarse and fine x axis

9. Aluminium adapter

10. Arca swiss 50mm clamp and 140mm plate - for mounting camera and bellows

The elastic band is stretched out over the end of the microscope block in use. The block is designed to be used vertically with the weight of the subject stage pulling the slack out of the focusing gears..used horizontally you need to replicate the effect or there’s a bit of play.
